emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Software Development
emerging_technologies.description: AI systems that can autonomously develop software, from coding to testing and deployment, significantly reducing human involvement.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: This could lead to a shift in job markets, with an increased demand for AI oversight roles and a potential decrease in traditional coding jobs.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: High adoption due to cost savings, speed, and scalability; however, concerns about job displacement and AI reliability might slow down mainstream acceptance.

emerging_technologies.name: Neural Lace
emerging_technologies.description: A brain-computer interface that integrates seamlessly with the human brain, allowing for direct communication between neural circuits and digital devices.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Raises ethical questions about privacy, consent, and the nature of human identity. Could enhance human cognitive abilities and offer new treatments for neurological disorders.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption might be slow due to ethical concerns, regulatory hurdles, and the need for extensive safety testing.

emerging_technologies.name: Self-Sustaining Lunar Base
emerging_technologies.description: A lunar base that can recycle resources, generate energy, and maintain human habitation with minimal Earth support.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could pave the way for long-term space colonization, offering insights into human adaptation in extraterrestrial environments.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Initial adoption would be limited to space agencies and private space companies; widespread adoption would depend on proving long-term viability and cost-effectiveness.

emerging_technologies.name: Quantum Blockchain
emerging_technologies.description: A blockchain system leveraging quantum computing for enhanced security, faster transaction processing, and decentralization.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could revolutionize financial systems, voting, and identity verification, but also poses risks related to quantum decryption of current encryption methods.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption would be driven by the need for unbreakable encryption and faster transaction speeds, but requires the maturity of quantum computing technology.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI-Powered Personal Assistants
mainstream_technologies.description: Personal assistants that manage schedules, communications, and provide real-time assistance with advanced predictive capabilities.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Already widespread, with integration into homes, workplaces, and personal devices, enhancing productivity and convenience.

mainstream_technologies.name: Autonomous Electric Vehicles
mainstream_technologies.description: Electric vehicles with full autonomy, capable of driving in complex urban environments with minimal human intervention.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Gaining traction due to environmental benefits, safety improvements, and regulatory support for autonomous driving.

epoch_themes.description: Advancements in AI and neural interfaces are leading to cognitive enhancements, allowing humans to interact with technology at a deeper level.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Shifts in human capability and identity, potential for new forms of inequality, and the need for new ethical frameworks.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased focus on cognitive health, education reform to incorporate AI, and a rise in human augmentation technologies.

epoch_themes.description: Efforts to make space exploration sustainable through recycling, energy generation, and minimal Earth dependency.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Encourages long-term thinking, raises questions about resource allocation, and fosters international collaboration.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Shift towards sustainable practices in space, increased interest in extraterrestrial living, and potential for new industries.
